intro: Zauschneria latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf bunchflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polemoniacaceae family and is characterized by its showy, showy orange to red flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to full sun conditions. It has linear to lance-shaped leaves and produces seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Zauschneria latifolia is often found in coastal and inland regions, thriving in well-drained soils.
